revised_title: The Histochemistry and Morphology of the Echinoid Axial Organ
tldr: This article examines the morphology and histochemistry of the axial organ in three echinoid species: Arbacia lixula, Diadema antillarum, and Paracentrotus lividus. The organ is described as primarily glandular and plays a role in defense against injury and invading organisms. The study investigates the various structures and functions of the organ, including the presence of pigments, secretions, and the role of amoebocytes.
